content:
Hello ! 

I recently got a new laptop (Lenovo Legion 5 I think) and while it's been working great, I've noticed a glitch that's happened a few times now. It's usually preceded by the image having some weird line pattern, I havent been able to take a picture of it but it's almost like the pixels have been shifted ever so slightly. After that the screen sometimes splits strangely (see image). I don't know if this is a hardware problem or a firefox thing but the only time it has happened was when I was on firefox so yeah...

title: Error code with API when connecting Mapsly to ActiveCampaign
content:
I am working with Mapsly on an integration with ActiveCampaign. They are trying to create a button but are receiving an error code. See message below. ___ I prepared a button that is supposed to send notes to ActiveCampaign, but I am getting this error:

cURL error 60: SSL certificate problem: certificate has expired (see https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html) for https://tributeinc.api-us1.com.api-us1.com/api/3/notes

Is it possible for you to send this error to the ActiveCampaign support and ask them how to fix this error? ___

Appreciate any guidance. Thank you. Lorna

title: Firefox blocked
content: I may have inadvertantly blocked Firefox from executing. I run Windows 11 on my desktop, and use SpyBot as my virus defender. Last night SpyBot may have run and prevented Firefox from running. This morning it would not open at all, no matter using a shortcut button or activating the program directly from Menu. I tried re-installing, but a window opens saying, "Hmm. For some reason we could not install Firefox." I tried uninstalling Mozilla but the window opens to initiate the process but in 20 minutes less than 1% of the procedure bar is lit and blinking. Do you have any suggestions?

title: Company requested removal of firefox from Work Computer
content: Hi I am a long time user of firefox because i love its customization and tools available to help me with my work and personal life. Recently i have been ordered to remove Firefox from the company laptop as it was deemed insecure by the IT and security department. I have been told to use MS edge and Google's Chrome. Their reasoning is "An inconsistent comparator in xslt/txNodeSorter could have resulted in potentially exploitable out-of-bounds access. Only affected version 122 and later. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 136 and Firefox ESR < 128.8." I do not know what this means. Is there something i can tell my IT department to argue against the directive to only use either Edge or Chrome. Best regards, F Silva
creator: Correia9

title: Add-on not available (NO OVERFLOW MENU???)
content: So I am running 31 add-ons. 30 of them ARE ACTIVE. (I've ALREADY ACTIVATED THEM.) Only 8 are showing up on the tool bar. I would like to select ONE that is not showing up for use. I have double, triple and quadruple checked, it is active...but it does not show up on that toolbar. I WOULD say that it is because there is not enough room, but there IS enough room for at least 3 others to be showing up. I can remember a day when there was 12 of them showing, and I had an arrow to select to see the "hidden" add-ons. That is not present. I cannot find a way to "show all"... unless it is just going to the install center to see that they are BOTH installed AND active. (Well, one is not active, but that is for a reason, and it's not the one that I want to use at this time.) While typing this, I tried something, I right clicked on the toolbar and selected customize, and I SEE the old familiar >> but it is grayed out. Once I click on "done" it disappears again. It is that ">>" that is missing. Yes, it's called "The overflow menu"... THAT is what is missing! How do I get that back?
creator: Twidget0831

title: Preferiti aggiunti in cartelle in barra utente che non vengono visualizzati
content: Buongiorno, riscontro da tempo del seguente problema: provando ad aggiungere dei preferiti in una cartella presente nella BARRA dei PREFERITI, questi preferiti vengono confermati come salvati senza alcun errore, ma poi andando ad aprire la cartelle dove sono stati messi, non sono mai presenti. Provato con qualsiasi sito , provato anche a rimuovere dei preferiti esistenti per verificare se fosse causato da un limite massimo di preferiti gestibili, ma anche in questo modo non sono visualizzati i nuovi preferiti salvati. Grazie.

title: lost passwords
content:
The latest firefox desktop update seems to have induced difficulties for my password manager:

1) under the menu tab, clicking 'passwords' opens a new page as if no passwords had ever been used (it has previously held an extensive collection of my various passwords).

2) Also, firefox not asking for my primary password and seems to have no record of it. 

    *Other profile info (saved pages, firefox preferences) looked intact.

3) following instructions from the mozilla help pages, i refreshed the current profile, then searched for previous profile. none of the other profiles had the missing passwords.

Please, help me find & recover my lost passwords!

Thank you!
creator: papagarz
